citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was a strong fecal odor noticeable when entering the kennel. There was a layer of dust on some of the kennel
structure. The licensee stated to the inspector that sanitizing was not being done every two weeks. Enclosures in use
must be sanitized every two weeks by washing all soiled surfaces with a soap solution and following with an appropriate
disinfectant or using a combination detergent/disinfectant. This sanitization is needed to control diseases and odors in the
kennel to keep the dogs healthy and comfortable. Sanitize the kennel every two weeks.
Correct by: 10-9-23

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The licensee has not yet administered heartworm preventative to all dogs in the kennel monthly this year as dictated by
the written program of veterinary care written by the attending veterinarian. The licensee is not doing preventative health
checks on all dogs in the kennel monthly as dictated in the program of veterinary care as written by the attending
veterinarian. Each dealer shall ensure that the attending veterinarian has the appropriate authority to ensure the provision
of adequate veterinary care and oversee the other aspects of animal care and use. Failure to provide this authority could
lead to health issues for the dogs in the kennel. Follow all written guidance in the program of veterinary care.
Correct by: 10-12-23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There was a strong fecal odor noticeable when entering the kennel. There was a layer of dust on some of the kennel 
structure. The licensee stated to the inspector that sanitizing was not being done every two weeks. Enclosures in use 
must be sanitized every two weeks by washing all soiled surfaces with a soap solution and following with an appropriate 
disinfectant or using a combination detergent/disinfectant. This sanitization is needed to control diseases and odors in the 
kennel to keep the dogs healthy and comfortable. Sanitize the kennel every two weeks. 
Correct by: 10-9-23 
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The licensee has not yet administered heartworm preventative to all dogs in the kennel monthly this year as dictated by 
the written program of veterinary care written by the attending veterinarian. The licensee is not doing preventative health 
checks on all dogs in the kennel monthly as dictated in the program of veterinary care as written by the attending 
veterinarian. Each dealer shall ensure that the attending veterinarian has the appropriate authority to ensure the provision 
of adequate veterinary care and oversee the other aspects of animal care and use. Failure to provide this authority could 
lead to health issues for the dogs in the kennel. Follow all written guidance in the program of veterinary care. 
Correct by: 10-12-23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
